messages.subject: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Hi Diego, I hope your week's off to a great start. Attached is our initial proposal for the Data360 integration with a breakdown of modules, licensing, and service tiers. Let me know what stands

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Thanks Bruce, I've reviewed the outline. It's comprehensive. A few areas I'd like clarification on — primarily the user limits and data sync cadence. Best, Diego On Mon, Jul 7, 2025 at 4:12

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Appreciate the quick look, Diego. For user limits — our base tier includes 250 seats, scalable in 100-user increments. As for sync cadence, it's hourly by default, though we can customize down to 5

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Hourly should work for now. We can revisit that later if real-time proves necessary. Also, does the $210K figure include support and training? — Diego

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Yes — the $210K covers platform access, white-glove onboarding, training workshops, and Tier 1 support for the first year. If preferred, we can itemize those for budget granularity. Cheers, Bruce On

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Itemized would help for internal alignment. Nothing alarming so far — I'll loop in finance once I get your breakdown. Diego On Mon, Jul 7, 2025 at 4:13 PM Bruce Wayne <bruce.wayne.goatforce@

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Of course — attached is the itemized pricing model as requested. Also happy to schedule a Q&A session with our onboarding team if needed. Let me know if that's helpful. Bruce On Mon, Jul 7,

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Appreciate the responsiveness. I'll review with finance by end of week. We may want to discuss contract duration next. Thanks, Diego On Mon, Jul 7, 2025 at 4:15 PM Bruce Wayne <bruce.wayne.

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Sounds good, Diego. I've blocked time for Friday in case you're free — just placeholder for now. Let me know if you need anything beforehand. — Bruce On Mon, Jul 7, 2025 at 4:15 PM Diego Lopez

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Friday works. I'll confirm mid-week. Also, would prefer to move over to Slack after that — easier for quick alignment. Best, Diego

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Perfect — I'll prep the Slack workspace and send the invite link after our Friday sync. Talk soon! Bruce On Mon, Jul 7, 2025 at 4:16 PM Diego Lopez <diego.lopez.boa2025@gmail.com> wrote:

messages.subject: Re: Initial Proposal for Data360 Integration
messages.text: Talk soon. — Diego On Mon, Jul 7, 2025 at 4:17 PM Bruce Wayne <bruce.wayne.goatforce@gmail.com> wrote: Perfect — I'll prep the Slack workspace and send the invite link after our Friday sync.

summary: The sales representative, Bruce Wayne, shared an initial proposal for Data360 integration with prospect Diego Lopez. Diego sought clarification on user limits, data sync cadence, and an itemized breakdown of the $210K cost including support and training. Bruce promptly addressed these points and provided the requested itemized pricing. The conversation concluded with a scheduled meeting for Friday and a plan to transition communication to Slack, indicating positive progress toward a deal.
